body.p: The publishing process is driven by a customization CSS.
To change the styling of the output, you need to:

ol.li: Create a CSS file that will contain all your customization. We recommend creating this file in your project directory. You can organize the CSS rules in separate files, but all need to be imported from a single master CSS file. For simiplicity we will discuss about a single CSS file.LESS files are supported (Less is a CSS pre-processor with a CSS-like syntax, that has a lot of features that speed up development)
Add the CSS custom rules. Depending on the use case, you can read one of the following sections.
Set the full path to the CSS file as args.css parameter value in the DITA Map PDF - WYSIWYG transformation scenario.
